meanings.definition: The state of having male and female reproductive organs on separate individuals.
meanings.sent1: In dioecies, some plants have only male flowers on one plant and female flowers on another.
meanings.sent2: The dioecies of certain fish species ensures successful reproduction through separate male and female organisms.
meanings.sent3: At the botanical garden, the dioecies of the rare plant caused confusion as visitors mistook the male plants for females.
meanings.sent4: The dioecies of the forest was like a dance, with male and female trees swaying together in harmony.
meanings.sent5: Learning about dioecies in biology class made the concept of separate sexes in nature fascinating and clear.

meanings.definition: The condition of a species having separate male and female individuals.
meanings.sent1: Dioecies in animals like lions mean distinct roles for males and females in the pride.
meanings.sent2: The dioecies of birds like eagles ensures both male and female contribute to raising their young.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper found the dioecies of the penguins amusing as the males and females had different personalities.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the dioecies of ants symbolizes teamwork and collaboration between males and females.
meanings.sent5: The concept of dioecies in nature highlights the diversity and complexity of life on Earth.
